byline.contributor: Mauricio Lima contributed reporting from Surt, Libya.

abstract: Hundreds of anti-Qaddafi militiamen converge on several neighborhoods of Tripoli in a rare burst of violence that may have been started with reports of pro-Qaddafi protests and an attempt to raise the former national flag; if confirmed, the protests would represent the boldest attempt by loyalist elements to assert their presence in the capital since its capture in August.
snippet: Hundreds of anti-Qaddafi militiamen fired heavy weapons on residential streets in a rare outburst of violence that may have been provoked by rumors of demonstrations by loyalists.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: Hundreds of anti-Qaddafi militiamen fired heavy weapons on residential streets in a rare outburst of violence that may have been provoked by rumors of demonstrations by loyalists.

headline.main: Qaddafi-Era Flag Is Said to Have Set Off Gunfire in Tripoli
headline.print_headline: Qaddafi-Era Flag Is Said to Have Set Off Gunfire in Tripoli
headline.seo: In Tripoli, Libya, Qaddafi Flag Said to Lead to Gunfire
